intro: Oreodaphne tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovarensis sandarac tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, rounded fruits. Oreodaphne tovarensis is known for its aromatic resin, which has been traditionally used in local crafts and medicinal practices. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various native fauna.
